dfischer.utils

Class HtmlParserFormItem

  • java.lang.Object
    • dfischer.utils.HtmlParserFormItem

  • public class HtmlParserFormItem
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains all data about a single HTML form item (input field, hidden field, option list ...).
    See Also:
    HtmlContentParser.getFormTable(), HtmlParserFormTable.getForms(), HtmlParserForm.getFormItemTable(), HtmlParserFormItemTable.getFormItems()

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getIndex()
      Returns the index of the form item within the form.
      java.lang.String getItemType()
      Returns the form item type (INPUT, BUTTON, SELECT ...) in UPPERCASE.
      java.lang.String getName()
      Returns the name of the form item.
      java.lang.String getOptionDisplayText(int optionIndex)
      Returns a specific option display text of a form item type which is an option list (item type = SELECT).
      java.lang.String[] getOptionDisplayTexts()
      Returns all option display texts of a form item type which is an option list (item type = SELECT).
      java.lang.String getOptionValue(int optionIndex)
      Returns a specific option value of a form item type which is an option list (item type = SELECT).
      java.lang.String getOptionValue(java.lang.String optionDisplayText)
      Returns a specific option value of a form item type which is an option list (item type = SELECT).
      java.lang.String[] getOptionValues()
      Returns all option values of a form item type which is an option list (item type = SELECT).
      java.lang.String getType()
      Returns the type of the form item (TEXT, HIDDEN, CHECKBOX ...) in UPPERCASE.
      java.lang.String getValue()
      Returns the value of the form item.
      boolean hasName()
      Determines if the form item contains a name.
      boolean isControlButton()
      Determines if the form item is a RESET or SUBMIT control-button or -image.
      boolean isLabel()
      Determines if the form item is a label.
      boolean isOptionList()
      Determines if the form item is an option list.

    • Method Detail

      • getIndex

        public int getIndex()
        Returns the index of the form item within the form. The first item has an index of 0 (zero).
        Returns:
        the index of the form item

      • hasName

        public boolean hasName()
        Determines if the form item contains a name. Hint: a valid name may also be an empty string.
        Returns:
        true if the form item contains a name.
        See Also:
        getName()

      • isLabel

        public boolean isLabel()
        Determines if the form item is a label.
        Returns:
        true if the form item is a label.

      • isOptionList

        public boolean isOptionList()
        Determines if the form item is an option list.
        Returns:
        true if the form item is an option list
        See Also:
        getOptionValues(), getOptionValue(int), getOptionValue(String)

      • isControlButton

        public boolean isControlButton()
        Determines if the form item is a RESET or SUBMIT control-button or -image.
        Returns:
        true if the form item is a RESET or SUBMIT control-button or -image

      • getItemType

        public java.lang.String getItemType()
        Returns the form item type (INPUT, BUTTON, SELECT ...) in UPPERCASE.
        Returns:
        the form item type in UPPERCASE or null if no form item type is available.

      • getType

        public java.lang.String getType()
        Returns the type of the form item (TEXT, HIDDEN, CHECKBOX ...) in UPPERCASE.
        Returns:
        the type of the form item in UPPERCASE or null if no type is available.

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Returns the name of the form item. Hint: a valid name may also be an empty string.
        Returns:
        the name of the form item or null if no name is available.
        See Also:
        hasName()

      • getValue

        public java.lang.String getValue()
        Returns the value of the form item.
        Returns:
        the value of the form item or null if no value is available.

      • getOptionValues

        public java.lang.String[] getOptionValues()
        Returns all option values of a form item type which is an option list (item type = SELECT).
        Returns:
        all option values of the option list. Returns an empty array if no options are available. Returns null if the form item type is not an option list.
        See Also:
        isOptionList()

      • getOptionValue

        public java.lang.String getOptionValue(int optionIndex)
        Returns a specific option value of a form item type which is an option list (item type = SELECT).
        Parameters:
        optionIndex - index of option
        Returns:
        a option value or null if no value is available.

      • getOptionValue

        public java.lang.String getOptionValue(java.lang.String optionDisplayText)
        Returns a specific option value of a form item type which is an option list (item type = SELECT).
        Parameters:
        optionDisplayText - display text of the option.
        Returns:
        a option value or null if no value is available.

      • getOptionDisplayTexts

        public java.lang.String[] getOptionDisplayTexts()
        Returns all option display texts of a form item type which is an option list (item type = SELECT).
        Returns:
        all option display texts of the option list. Returns an empty array if no display texts are available. Returns null if the form item type is not an option list.
        See Also:
        isOptionList()

      • getOptionDisplayText

        public java.lang.String getOptionDisplayText(int optionIndex)
        Returns a specific option display text of a form item type which is an option list (item type = SELECT).
        Parameters:
        optionIndex - index of option.
        Returns:
        an option display text or null if no option display text is available.
